revision.text: {{WikiProject A Song of Ice and Fire|class=B|importance=mid}} {{TelevisionWikiProject|class=B|importance=High}} {{dyktalk|16 June|2013|entry=... that the central event of the ''[[Game of Thrones (TV series)|Game of Thrones]]'' episode "'''[[The Rains of Castamere]]'''" was the initial inspiration for the producers to adapt [[A Song of Ice and Fire]] for television?}} ==DYK== I have [[Template:Did you know nominations/The Rains of Castamere|nominated]] this article to be featured on [[WP:DYK]]. Feel free to take a look and suggest changes to the hook. [[User:Adabow|Adabow]] ([[User talk:Adabow|talk]]) 04:53, 4 June 2013 (UTC) Its very well written [[User:Jeffreystringer|Jeffreystringer]] ([[User talk:Jeffreystringer|talk]]) 15:05, 4 June 2013 (UTC) ==Fan community reaction== I'm sure we've all seen the YouTube clips of people reacting in shock and horror at what transpired in the episode. If there are articles mentioning the reactions, then I think that should be added to the reception part of the article. --[[User:Matt723star|Matt723star]] ([[User talk:Matt723star|talk]]) 19:39, 6 June 2013 (UTC) :If by "that", you mean mention of the reactions sourced from articles, I agree. But we shouldn't link to the videos themselves, either as references or external links. Some are pretty funny, but no real educational value. I personally recommend watching them, but Wikipedia isn't hear to help things "go viral". And probably violate copyright, even if you can only hear the audio. ::[http://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2013/06/06/george-r-r-martin-watches-reactions-to-the-red-wedding/ This] might help. [[User:InedibleHulk|InedibleHulk]] [[User_Talk:InedibleHulk|(talk)]] 20:14, [[June 6]], [[2013]] (UTC) :::I've added a short paragraph about fan reaction videos, linking to a couple of articles that discuss it as well as having some of the videos embedded on them. I've also mentioned the parody reaction video from That Guy with the Glasses.[[Special:Contributions/2.28.174.217|2.28.174.217]] ([[User talk:2.28.174.217|talk]]) 19:00, 10 June 2013 (UTC) ::::Good! That's exactly what I meant by adding it, I didn't mean for it as a way to get something viral, I meant for it to be added because it was something that happened pertaining to the episode. It caused a fandom reaction of the likes we haven't seen in a long, long time. --[[User:Matt723star|Matt723star]] ([[User talk:Matt723star|talk]]) 19:14, 10 June 2013 (UTC) == Should we be linking to the ''Game of Thrones'' wiki? == I linked to the ''Game of Thrones'' wiki's article on this subject and was reverted by [[User:Corvoe]] with the edit summary ''Links to fan wikis aren't appropriate for Wikipedia.''[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Rains_of_Castamere&diff=613897879&oldid=613893201] I would normally be sympathetic to this position, but the fact is that there are several FA-level articles on similar topics that link to similar fan wikis, such as [[Palpatine]]. I also think that this link fits in accordance with [[WP:ELNO]] (for instance, fan wikis are free to include more in-depth plot summaries than we are, so it does "provide a unique resource beyond what the article would contain if it became a featured article"). This is a point [[User:Flyer22]] also made.[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Rains_of_Castamere&diff=613898530&oldid=613897879] Any thoughts on this? [[Special:Contributions/126.0.96.220|126.0.96.220]] ([[User talk:126.0.96.220|talk]]) 06:24, 22 June 2014 (UTC) :I think the difference between the Game of Thrones Wikia and Wookieepedia is that Wookieepedia has its own article. It's notable on its own, so its inclusion there makes sense. I don't know that the GoT Wikia (which I contribute to, in a mostly unrelated note) has "a substantial history of stability and a substantial number of editors". Perhaps in the future, but at the moment, it's seeming like it isn't up to par with [[WP:ELNO]]. My edit summary was inaccurate, and I apologize for that, but even after reading up a little bit, I stick by my revert. '''[[User:Corvoe|Corvoe]]''' [[User talk:Corvoe|(speak to me)]] 06:47, 22 June 2014 (UTC) == RfC participation request == There's an RS RfC on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Oathkeeper#RfC:_Blog_source--usable_for_facts.3F Oathkeeper] talk page. Participation (and fresh voices) would be welcome. [[User:Darkfrog24|Darkfrog24]] ([[User talk:Darkfrog24|talk]]) 01:43, 16 August 2014 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[The Rains of Castamere]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=716558772 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive http://web.archive.org/web/20130610082630/http://blogs.independent.co.uk:80/2013/06/06/game-of-thrones-the-rains-of-castamere-summed-up-in-videos/ to http://blogs.independent.co.uk/2013/06/06/game-of-thrones-the-rains-of-castamere-summed-up-in-videos/ When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.â€”[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 11:22, 22 April 2016 (UTC)
